column4: so i have an external harddrive that has fedora on it with encryption
i plug it into the computer i'm on now
which is ubuntu
and it asks for the encryption password and when i give it it gives me this error message Error unlocking device: cryptsetup exited with exit code 239: Command failed: Device already exists
You can run the "unlocking" manually: `cryptsetup luksOpen /dev/your-crypted-partition name-for-uncrypted-device`
i get this after doing that 160 GB Hard Disk: 160 GB Encrypted
No, run the command without "`".
that's what i did
What is the name of the encrypted partition?
No, I mean in /dev/
Should be something like /dev/sdb1 for example
What does `blkid` show you?
i assume you mean to run the blkid in the terminal? if so nothing
sdc1
(Where did you run the cryptsetup cmd, if not in a terminal?) Maybe you need to run every command prepended with `sudo`
cryptsetup: luksOpen: requires <device> <name>  as arguments
what does the cryptsetup: luksOpen: requires <device> <name>  as arguments mean
That's exactly the command I gave you before. `cryptsetup luksOpen source target`
when i run it that's what it gives me
What exactly do you run? I can't see xour screen.
now i get Command failed: Can not access device
at least uit's letting me format now
